instructions.instruction: Create a README.md file for the {{directory}}
The purpose of this readme is to provide necessary context to LLMs when they work on this directory.
The readme should describe the purpose of the directory, the files and subdirectories inside it, and the relationships between them.
Include a clear directory structure overview using tree format or bullet points.

For each significant file or subdirectory, provide: - Purpose and functionality - Key dependencies or relationships - Usage examples where applicable - Any important configuration or setup requirements
Add a "Getting Started" section if the directory contains executable code or requires setup.
Include installation instructions, prerequisites, and environment setup if needed.
Document any APIs, interfaces, or public methods with clear examples.
Use proper markdown formatting with headers, code blocks, tables, and links where appropriate.
Keep the language clear, concise, and technical but accessible.
Add badges for build status, version, license, etc. if relevant.
Include a table of contents for longer documentation.
Document any environment variables, configuration files, or external dependencies.
Add examples of expected input/output formats where relevant.
Include links to related documentation, external resources, or references.
The readme should be written in a way that is easy to understand and follow.

output-format.format: Structure the README.md with the following sections (adapt as needed): 1. Title and brief description 2. Table of Contents (for longer docs) 3. Overview/Purpose 4. Directory Structure 5. Installation/Setup (if applicable) 6. Usage/Getting Started (if applicable) 7. File Descriptions 8. Configuration (if applicable) 9. Examples 10. References

quality-guidelines.guideline: Ensure all code examples are properly formatted and tested
Use consistent terminology throughout the documentation
Make the documentation scannable with clear headings and bullet points
Provide context for why certain decisions were made
Include performance considerations or limitations if relevant
